page.title: 12Events LISVANE
page.content: In 1980, the section of the{motorway to the north of Lisvane was completed.In 1972/73,the Graig Preservation Society had been formed to monitor plans in the interest the interest of Lisvane. An embanked route was opposed and a cutting and banks,to minimize noise,were suggested and accepted.The motorway split farmland and destoyed some old buildings.The entrance to the {leisure}amenity,Cefn Onn Park,north of the motorway,now via a subway.{Community Life}is centred on the Memorial Hall,completed in 1951 after huge efforts to raise Â£200. Originally built to utility standards it is to be replaced shortly.The Community Association produces monthly newsletters with details of local events & an annual festival.{Public {footpaths}have all been restored, also styles,bridges etc.
